scenario_text.value:
Hello there, Takuma. Are you all ready for
the final battle?

Yup, I’m all set. I’ve just been going around
and checking up on everyone.
Wasn’t Gabumon with you?

Oh, yes. He’s outside keeping an eye on our
surroundings right now.

He seems unaccustomed to being around others,
perhaps because he was alone for so long.

So I’ve been talking with Renamon about
everything that’s happened.

Really, I wish you wouldn’t use me as some
excuse to kill time.

Haha, don’t be like that. After all, you’re
the only one who can tell me about my sister.
Hmph.

Ahaha, well, I’m glad it seems like you’re
getting along.
Indeed.

Listen, Takuma. I want you all to know
I appreciate how good you’ve been to me.

If it weren’t for all of you, I’m sure I’d be
dead by now. Not preparing to save my sister.
(I should tell the professor that...)
...it wasn’t just us.
...you did a lot too.
...we got lucky.
...it wasn’t just us.
...it wasn’t just us.

We all owe so much to so many others.
Gabumon, Renamon, Jijimon...everyone, really.
Yeah, right...
...you did a lot too.

You did everything you could to survive. We
just helped out a little.

All the help in the world won’t save someone
who doesn’t want to be saved.

Yes, that’s a good way of putting it. This
world is quite harsh.
...we got lucky.
...we got lucky.

We were in a lot of situations where just one
mistake could have cost someone’s life.

It was lucky that we met Agumon and the
others, and we all learned to work together.
Yes, I feel the same way.
Renamon, I have you to thank as well.
Don’t bother. I did betray you, after all.

I just wanted...I wanted to be the one to
save Miyuki.

Yes, thank you so much for trying to save my
sister.

You know, Takuma, after all that’s happened,
I’m glad I was able to come to this world.

After all, it’s how I was able to befriend
such an amazing group of young people.
You mean...you consider us your friends?

Is that not okay? Would you rather not be
friends with an old man like me?
No, that’s great!

We’re friends, all of us, and that will never
change!
Heheh... Thank you.

(The professor’s really enjoying talking with
Renamon. I’d better not interrupt.)
